title: 110_s2812
content: The Medicare Telehealth Improvement Act of 2008, also known as the Act, includes provisions such as an increase in the number of types of originating sites and the expansion of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services. It aims to improve the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Act includes provisions to increase the types of originating sites for telehealth services, such as skilled nursing facilities, renal dialysis facilities, community mental health centers, and other sites with a telecommunications system. The Act expands telehealth services to include additional originating sites with a telecommunications system, and exempts certain originating sites from facility fees. The Act expands telehealth services to include additional originating sites with a telecommunications system and exempts certain sites from facility fees. The amendments made by this section will apply to services provided 90 days after the enactment of this Act. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services. Expansion of practitioners eligible to furnish telehealth services includes amending Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act to redefine the term 'practitioner' to include physical therapists, occupational therapists, and qualified speech-language pathologists. The amendments to Section 1834(m) of the Social Security Act expand the list of practitioners eligible to provide telehealth services to include physical therapists, occupational therapists, qualified speech-language pathologists, audiologists, certified providers, and other individuals or entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The effective date for these changes is 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The text chunk "SEC. 4. IMPROVEMENT OF PROCESS FOR UPDATING THE LIST OF TELEHEALTH SERVICES." summarizes the section on improving the process for updating the list of telehealth services. The Telehealth Advisory Committee will provide recommendations to the Secretary of Health and Human Services for adding or deleting services and HCPCS codes. If a recommendation is not implemented, the Secretary must publish a statement in the Federal Register explaining why. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, appointed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members, including practicing physicians and non-physicians, to recommend additions or deletions of services and HCPCS codes for authorized payment under the Social Security Act. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, appointed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members, including practicing physicians and non-physician health care providers with experience in telemedicine or telehealth services. The Telehealth Advisory Committee, appointed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, consists of 7 members representing a balance of specialties and geographic regions. Members serve terms specified by the Secretary, meet twice a year, and consider stakeholder recommendations. The committee is permanent and exempt from certain administrative limitations. The Secretary will establish the Advisory Committee without being limited by the number of advisory committees allowed within the Department of Health and Human Services or elsewhere.
